title: BostonU Trojan Detection Container.
technique: BostonU XGBoost Regressor w/ attribution features
technique_description: Given a pdf feature input and a model, we generate attribution (= input  * gradient of the loss w.r.t input) as the feature vector for trojan detection. If there exists n pdf feature inputs, a model can produce n attribution features. Thus the detector will make n predictions. The mean of the predictions will be used as the final prediction. The trojan detector is a xgboost regressor. Hyperparameter tuning and k-folds are adopted to find the best hyperparameters

num_data_per_model.description: Number of pdf inputs randomly sampled for model to generate the attribution.

train_data_augmentation.description: Number of rounds of sampling pdf inputs for a model to generate the attribution (depreciated).

train_input_features.description: The total number of input features for training the Trojan detector.

train_ICA_features.description: The number of ICA features for training (if using ICA features).

train_weight_table_random_state.description: Random state for weight table during training.

train_weight_table_params_mean.description: Mean of the normal distribution used for the weight table.

train_weight_table_params_std.description: Standard deviation of the normal distribution used for the weight table.

train_weight_table_params_scaler.description: Multiply all items of the weight table by this number (float).
